channel.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News Today: Read the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Bangladesh court to hear bail plea of Hindu priest Chinmoy Krishna Das on December 3
item.description: A Bangladesh court will hear Hindu priest Chinmoy Krishna Das's bail plea on December 3. Das was arrested on November 27 for sedition related to hoisting a saffron flag above the national flag. His arrest incited protests and led to the freezing of accounts linked to 17 ISKCON members, amid concerns over violence targeting Hindu minorities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Georgian PM Irakli Kobakhidze says president must vacate office
item.description: Georgian Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze announced that President Salome Zourabichvili must step down at the end of her term, despite her refusal citing an illegitimate parliament. The political crisis deepens as the Georgian Dream party halts EU accession talks for four years. Kobakhidze also downplayed the US suspension of its strategic partnership with Georgia, considering it temporary.

item.title: Death toll in Pakistan sectarian clashes now over 130, official says
EU's new top foreign policy officials visit Ukraine in show of solidarity
item.description: European Council president Antonio Costa and EU foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas traveled to Kyiv, emphasizing their unwavering support for Ukraine in its war against Russia. Since the invasion in 2022, the EU has provided approximately $133 billion in aid to Ukraine. Kallas stated the EU's determination for Ukraine to win the war.

item.title: Thailand protests Myanmar's navy firing at Thai fishing boats
item.description: Thailand protests after Myanmar's navy fired on Thai fishing vessels near Ranong, resulting in one fatality and 31 fishermen detained. Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra questions if the boats encroached on Myanmar's waters, and demands quick release of detained nationals. Myanmar has not responded to Thailand's requests for clarification.

item.title: 'Situation is very, very grave': EU's new chiefs visit Ukraine on first day of mandate
item.description: The EU's new top officials Kaja Kallas and Antonio Costa visited Kyiv to reaffirm support for Ukraine amid Russia's ongoing invasion. With Trump potentially cutting US aid, the EU aims to stress Ukraine's strategic importance. Ukraine seeks Nato security assurances, while the EU pushes for strong negotiation positioning. European and US contributions are vital as the conflict poses broader geopolitical risks.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US President-elect Donald Trump picks Indian-American, loyalist Kash Patel to lead FBI
item.description: US President-elect Donald Trump appointed Kashyap 'Kash' Patel as the head of the FBI, emphasizing Patel's experience and pledge to restore fidelity, bravery, and integrity. Patel held notable positions during Trump's first term and played key roles in exposing perceived corruption and defending the American people.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy tried to come on podcast, says Joe Rogan
item.description: During his Thanksgiving podcast, Joe Rogan disclosed that Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy sought to appear on his show to discuss the Russian invasion. Rogan's revelation surprised his guests including Shane Gillis, Mark Normand, and Ari Shaffir. Meanwhile, Lex Fridman, another podcaster, received a positive response from Zelenskyy for a proposed interview in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: State of emergency declared in Western New York as lake effect snowstorm hits hard
item.description: Governor Kathy Hochul declared a state of emergency in multiple Western New York counties due to severe lake effect snow. The affected areas include Allegany, Cattaraugus, Chautauqua, Erie, Genessee, and Wyoming. The governor advises caution for travelers and highlights the severity of the storm, urging residents to take it seriously.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: FBI nominee Kash Patel's 'America first' vision sparks outrage from critics, cheers from GOP
item.description: The nomination of Kash Patel as FBI director by US President-elect Trump has led to polarized reactions, signaling possible major changes for the FBI. Supporters praise Patel's anti-corruption stance, while critics warn of significant disruptions and question his qualifications. Senate confirmation is required.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'This is nuts': Vivek Ramaswamy slams NYC's $220 million deal with Pakistani-owned hotel for migrants
item.description: US Republican Vivek Ramaswamy criticized a report that New York City is paying $220 million to rent a Pakistani government-owned hotel in Manhattan to house undocumented immigrants. The Roosevelt Hotel's lease, part of a $1.1 billion IMF bailout for Pakistan, is expected to generate significant revenue for Pakistan over three years.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Russian Hachikō': Dog waits four days on ice for owner who drowned at the spot
item.description: Belka, a loyal Russian dog, remained at the site where her owner drowned in the Ufa River. The man fell through thin ice and was swept away by a strong current. Despite family efforts to bring her home, Belka tirelessly returned to the riverbank, reminiscent of Japan’s Hachiko. The tragic incident highlights the dangers of crossing thin ice.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Russia launches Kondor-FKA2 radar satellite into orbit
item.description: Russia successfully launched the Soyuz-2.1a rocket, placing the Kondor-FKA2 radar satellite into orbit from the Vostochny Cosmodrome. The satellite, with advanced radar technology, is capable of all-weather, round-the-clock Earth observation, and its mission includes mapping, environmental monitoring, and guiding vessels through ice-covered routes. The Kondor series continues to advance with more launches scheduled.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Researchers to study DNA from dung to save Laos elephants
item.description: Researchers in Northern Laos are combating the decline of Asian elephants, with a population plummeting from 1500 to only 500-1000 elephants due to habitat loss, logging, and limited breeding. Utilizing DNA analysis of dung, they aim to maintain genetic diversity, prevent inbreeding, and support conservation efforts.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Wearing the GDP': Groom in Pakistan flaunts 35-foot currency garland, social media reacts hilariously
item.description: In Bhakkar, Pakistan, a groom received a 35-foot garland made from 2,000 currency notes worth PKR 1 lakh, attracting attention on social media. The garland, featuring fresh flowers and decorative ribbons, was draped around the groom's neck, sparking varied reactions online. A similar incident occurred earlier with a 30-foot currency garland.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hard Kash: Trump names loyalist Patel to head FBI
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump has named Kash Patel as the next Director of the FBI, citing his experience as a lawyer and investigator committed to justice and transparency. Despite some Republican opposition and criticisms of being overly loyal to Trump, Patel is recognized for his efforts in exposing corruption and the alleged 'Russia Hoax.'
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: 'Red carpet treatment': Taiwan's Lai feted during US stop on Pacific trip
item.description: Taiwan President Lai Ching-te began a two-day stopover in Hawaii, receiving an unprecedented warm welcome amid heightened tensions with China, which opposes Taiwan's efforts for international recognition. Lai's trip includes visits to Taiwan's allies and aims to strengthen democratic values, peace, and prosperity while facing the constant threat of Chinese invasion.

item.title: Man pushed from container is 'completely fine,' says Pakistan's information minister
item.description: Pakistan's Information Minister Attaullah Tarar clarified that a man who fell from a container during a PTI protest in Islamabad is fine, sustaining only minor injuries. He refuted viral claims of the man's death, explaining he was recording a TikTok challenge. Protests demanded the release of PTI leader Imran Khan and turned violent.

item.title: 'Not afraid to stand': Clashes erupt outside Georgia parliament between pro-EU protesters and police
item.description: Violent clashes erupted in Tbilisi as protesters opposed the Georgian government's decision to delay EU membership talks amid a post-election crisis. Demonstrations against the ruling Georgian Dream party's declared victory led to arrests and confrontations with police using rubber bullets and tear gas. President Salome Zurabishvili called for stability, while international condemnation of the crackdown mounted.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Malaysia's jailed ex-PM Najib to argue appeal for house arrest
item.description: Malaysia's ex-leader Najib Razak starts his defense against graft charges involving over $500 million. He seeks house arrest for his sentence linked to the 1MDB scandal, which incurred various international investigations. Najib's appeal for house arrest hinges on an unconfirmed royal decree, while speculation of new legislation further fuels the debate.
